property.name: mr3.runtime
property.description: tez: use Tez 0.9.1 runtime. spark: use Spark runtime.

property.name: mr3.master.mode
property.description: local-thread: DAGAppMaster starts as a new thread inside MR3Client. local-process: DAGAppMaster starts as a new process on the same machine where MR3Client is running. yarn: DAGAppMaster starts as a new container in the Hadoop cluster. kubernetes: DAGAppMaster starts as a pod in the Kubernetes cluster.

property.name: mr3.am.acls.enabled
property.description: true: enable ACLs for DAGAppMaster and DAGs. false: disable ACLS for DAGAppMaster and DAGs.

property.name: mr3.cluster.additional.classpath
property.description: Additional classpath for DAGAppMaster and ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.cluster.use.hadoop-libs
property.description: true: include the classpath defined in YarnConfiguration.YARN_APPLICATION_CLASSPATH. false: do not include the classpath defined in YarnConfiguration.YARN_APPLICATION_CLASSPATH.

property.name: mr3.am.max.java.heap.fraction
property.description: Fraction of memory to be allocated for Java heap in DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.container.max.java.heap.fraction
property.description: Fraction of memory to be allocated for Java heap in ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.async.logging
property.description: true: use asynchronous logging. false: use synchronous logging.

property.name: mr3.lib.uris
property.description: URIs for the MR3 library jar files

property.name: mr3.aux.uris
property.description: URIs for the MR3 auxiliary jar files

property.name: mr3.queue.name
property.description: Name of the Yarn queue to which the MR3 job is submitted

property.name: mr3.application.tags
property.description: Comma-separated list of application tags for the MR3 job

property.name: mr3.application.scheduling.properties.map
property.description: Comma-separated list of scheduling properties for the MR3 job (e.g., `foo1=bar1,foo2=bar2`)

property.name: mr3.credentials.path
property.description: Path to the credentials for MR3

property.name: mr3.am.staging-dir
property.description: Staging directory for DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.am.staging.dir.check.ownership.permission
property.description: true: check the ownership and directory permission of the staging directory. false: do not check. Set to false if the staging directory reside on S3 which has notion of ownership and directory permission.

property.name: mr3.am.resource.memory.mb
property.description: Size of memory in MB for DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.am.resource.cpu.cores
property.description: Number of cores for DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.am.launch.cmd-opts
property.description: Command-line options for launching DAGAppMaster. Additional options for optimization: -XX:+UseStringDeduplication

property.name: mr3.am.launch.env
property.description: Environment variables for launching DAGAppMaster separated by ",". Each entry takes either "VAR=VALUE" separated by "=" or "VAR". In the latter case, the value in the system environment is used.

property.name: mr3.am.max.app.attempts
property.description: Max number of Yarn ApplicationAttempts for the MR3 job

property.name: mr3.am.log.level
property.description: Logging level for DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.am.local.working-dir
property.description: Local working directory for DAGAppMaster running in LocalThread or LocalProcess mode

property.name: mr3.am.local.log-dir
property.description: Logging directory for DAGAppMaster running in LocalThread or LocalProcess mode

property.name: mr3.cancel.delegation.tokens.on.completion
property.description: true: cancel delegation tokens when the MR3 job completes. false: do not cancel delegation tokens.

property.name: mr3.dag.status.pollinterval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for retrieving the status of running DAGs

property.name: mr3.am.session.mode
property.description: true: create MR3 SessionClient. false: create MR3 JobClient.

property.name: mr3.session.client.timeout.secs
property.description: Time in seconds for terminating MR3 SessionClient with a timeout

property.name: mr3.am.worker.mode
property.description: local: ContainerWorkers start as threads inside DAGAppMaster. yarn: ContainerWorkers start as containers in the Hadoop cluster. kubernetes: ContainerWorkers start as Pods in the Kubernetes cluster.

property.name: mr3.am.max.num.concurrent.dags
property.description: Max number of DAGs that can run concurrently in DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.am.shutdown.rightaway
property.description: true: DAGAppMaster does not wait until MR3Client retrieves the final states of all DAGs. false: DAGAppMaster waits until MR3Client retrieves the final states of all DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.shutdown.sleep.max.ms
property.description: Time in milliseconds to wait until MR3Client retrieves the final states of all DAGs

property.name: mr3.am.local.resourcescheduler.min.memory.mb
property.description: Min size of memory in MB to reserve for all local ContainerWorkers running in DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.am.local.resourcescheduler.max.memory.mb
property.description: Max size of memory in MB to reserve for all local ContainerWorkers running in DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.am.local.resourcescheduler.max.cpu.cores
property.description: Max number of cores for all local ContainerWorkers running in DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.am.local.resourcescheduler.native.fraction
property.description: Fraction of memory to be allocated for native memory for all local ContainerWorkers running in DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.am.delete.local.working-dir
property.description: true: DAGAppMaster running in LocalThread or LocalProcess mode deletes its local working directory upon termination. false: DAGAppMaster running in LocalThread or LocalProcess mode does not delete its local working directory upon termination. If mr3.am.delete.local.working-dir is set to true, ShutdownManager may fail to read class files (e.g., Configuration.class in hadoop-common-3.1.2.jar), in which case DAGAppMaster in LocalProcess does not terminate properly.

property.name: mr3.am.taskcommunicator.type
property.description: protobuf: use Protobuf for communication between TaskCommunicator and ContainerWorkers. protowritable: use Protobuf + Writable for communication between TaskCommunicator and ContainerWorkers. writable: use Writable for communication between TaskCommunicator and ContainerWorkers. direct: use direct communication between TaskCommunicator and local ContainerWorkers.

property.name: mr3.am.taskcommunicator.thread.count
property.description: Number of threads in TaskCommunicator for serving requests from ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.am.resourcescheduler.max.requests.per.taskscheduler
property.description: Max number of containers that TaskScheduler can request to Yarn ResourceScheduler at once

property.name: mr3.am.rm.heartbeat.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds of heartbeats in AMRMClientAsync

property.name: mr3.dag.priority.scheme
property.description: fifo: assign DAG priorities on FIFO basis. concurrent: assign the same priority to all DAGs. Not set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.vertex.priority.scheme
property.description: Scheme for assigning priorities to Vertexes. Available options: intact, roots, leaves, postorder, normalize. Not set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.client.thread-count
property.description: Number of threads in DAGClientServer for serving requests from MR3Clients

property.name: mr3.heartbeat.task.timeout.ms
property.description: Time in milliseconds for triggering heartbeat timeout for TaskAttempts (counted after being fetched by ContainerWorkers)

property.name: mr3.heartbeat.container.timeout.ms
property.description: Time in milliseconds for triggering heartbeat timeout for ContainerWorkers. Should be (much) larger than the total time for sleeping due to mr3.container.task.failure.num.sleeps.

property.name: mr3.task.heartbeat.timeout.check.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for checking heartbeat timeout for TaskAttempts

property.name: mr3.container.heartbeat.timeout.check.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for checking heartbeat timeout for ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.container.idle.timeout.ms
property.description: Time in milliseconds for triggering timeout for idle ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.am.node-blacklisting.enabled
property.description: true: enable node blacklisting. false: disable node blacklisting.

property.name: mr3.am.maxtaskfailure.percent
property.description: Percentage of TaskAttempt failures that puts a node in an unusable state

property.name: mr3.am.max.safe.resource.percent.blacklisted
property.description: Max percentage of resource to be allocated to a node that is blacklisted

property.name: mr3.am.min.safe.resource.percent.blacklisted
property.description: Min percentage of resource to be allocated to a node that is blacklisted

property.name: mr3.dag.delete.local.dir
property.description: true: ask ContainerWorkeres to delete DAG-local directories. false: do not ask (as in Spark on MR3).

property.name: mr3.dag.recovery.enabled
property.description: true: enable DAG recovery when DAGAppMaster restarts. false: disable DAG recovery when DAGAppMaster restarts.

property.name: mr3.am.max.finished.reported.dags
property.description: Max number of DAGs whose final states are kept in DAGAppMaster after being reported to MR3Client

property.name: mr3.am.generate.dag.graph.viz
property.description: true: create DOT graph files showing the structure of DAGs on the working directory of DAGAppMaster. false: do not create DOT graph files.

property.name: mr3.container.scheduler.scheme
property.description: none: do not recycle ContainerWorkers. fifo: use FIFO scheduling for recycling ContainerWorkers. fair: use fair scheduling for recycling ContainerWorkers.

property.name: mr3.container.scheduler.remove.empty.kind
property.description: true: remove ContainerKind with no ContainerGroups and reserve ContainrWorkers for recycling only if their ContainerKind has multiple ContainerGroups. false: never remove ContainerKind and reserve all ContainrWorkers for recycling.

property.name: mr3.dag.queue.scheme
property.description: Scheme for mapping DAGs to queues of TaskAttempts in TaskScheduler. Available options: common, individual Can be set for individual ContainerGroups.

property.name: mr3.taskattempt.queue.scheme
property.description: Scheme for managing the queue of TaskAttempts in TaskScheduler. Available options: basic, simple, opt, indexed Can be set for individual ContainerGroups. For common workloads, simple should be used. Scheduling in opt and indexed can be slightly faster than in simple. basic does not use the optimization for increasing the temporal locality of intermediate data and should be used only for performance comparison.

property.name: mr3.container.stop.cross.dag.reuse
property.description: true: stop cross-DAG container reuse for the current ContainerGroup. false: do not update the current ContainerGroup with regard to cross-DAG container reuse. Can be set for individual ContainerGroups.

property.name: mr3.container.reuse
property.description: true: reuse ContainerWorkers in the current ContainerGroup. false: use each ContainerWorker only for a single TaskAttempt. Can be set for individual ContainerGroups.

property.name: mr3.container.resourcescheduler.type
property.description: local: create local ContainerWorkers in DAGAppMaster for the current ContainerGroup. yarn: create Yarn ContainerWorkers for the current ContainerGroup. kubernetes: create Kubernetes ContainerWorkers for the current ContainerGroup. Can be set for individual ContainerGroups.

property.name: mr3.container.combine.taskattempts
property.description: true: allow multiple TaskAttempts to run concurrently in a ContainerWorker. false: allow only one TaskAttempt to run at a time in a ContainerWorker. Can be set for individual ContainerGroups.

property.name: mr3.container.mix.taskattempts
property.description: true: allow TaskAttempts from different DAGs to run concurrently in a ContainerWorker. false: use each ContainerWorker for a single DAG exclusively. Can be set for individual ContainerGroups.

property.name: mr3.container.max.num.workers
property.description: Max number of ContainerWorkers that can be created by a ContainerGroup. Can be set for individual ContainerGroups.

property.name: mr3.container.log.level
property.description: Logging level for ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.container.launch.cmd-opts
property.description: Command-line options for launching ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.container.launch.env
property.description: Environment variables for launching ContainerWorkers. Each entry takes either "VAR=VALUE" separated by "=" or "VAR". In the latter case, the value in the system environment is used.

property.name: mr3.container.kill.policy
property.description: container.kill.wait.workervertex: stop a ContainerWorker only if no more TaskAttempts are to arrive. container.kill.nowait: stop a ContainerWorker right away if it is not serving any TaskAttempt.

property.name: mr3.use.daemon.shufflehandler
property.description: Number of shuffle handlers in each ContainerWorker. On Kubernetes, a value of 0 causes the creation of processes for shuffle handlers.

property.name: mr3.daemon.shuffle.service-id
property.description: Service identifier for the shuffle handler

property.name: mr3.daemon.shuffle.port
property.description: Port number for the shuffle handler

property.name: mr3.am.min.cluster.resource.memory.mb
property.description: Min size of memory in MB that DAGAppMaster assumes as the cluster resource when initializing Map Tasks. Usually affects DAGs when no ContainerWorkers are running. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.min.cluster.resource.cpu.cores
property.description: Min number of cores that DAGAppMaster assumes as the cluster resource when initializing Map Tasks. Usually affects DAGs when no ContainerWorkers are running. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.task.max.failed.attempts
property.description: Max number of TaskAttempts to create for Task. Must be greater than zero. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.task.no.retry.errors
property.description: Comma-separated list of names of Exceptions and Errors that prevent the re-execution of Tasks. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.task.retry.on.fatal.error
property.description: true: retry even if TaskAttempts fail with fatal errors. false: do not retry if TaskAttempts fail with fatal errors. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.notify.destination.vertex.complete
property.description: true: notify ContainerWorker of the completion of all destination Vertexes so that it can delete the directory for intermediate data of the source Vertex. false: do not notify. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.commit-all-outputs-on-dag-success
property.description: true: commit the output of all Vertexes when DAG completes successfully. false: commit the output when Vertex completes successfully. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.permit.custom.user.class
property.description: true: allow users to use custom Java Classes inside DAGAppMaster for InputInitializer, VertexManager, OutputCommiter. false: do not allow users to use custom Java classes inside DAGAppMaster. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.task.concurrent.run.threshold.percent
property.description: Percentage of Tasks that complete before starting speculative execution. Can be set to an integer between 1 and 100. If set to 100, speculative execution of TaskAttempts is disabled. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.task.concurrent.run.min.threshold.ms
property.description: Minimum of the maximum execution time (in milliseconds) of Tasks that complete before starting speculative execution. For example, a value of 10000 means that if all Tasks complete within 10 seconds before starting speculative execution, we use 10 seconds as their maximum execution time. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.task.concurrent.run.multiplier
property.description: Multiplier of the maximum execution time of Tasks that complete before starting speculative execution. Can be set for individual DAGs.

property.name: mr3.am.task.concurrent.run.enable.root.vertex
property.description: true: Speculative execution is effective on root Vertexes with no ancestors. false: Speculative execution is not effective on root Vertexes.

property.name: mr3.container.get.command.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for retrieving commands in ContainerWorkers that are currently serving TaskAttempts

property.name: mr3.container.busy.wait.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for retrieving commands in idle ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.task.am.heartbeat.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for sending heartbeats from TaskAttempts. Set to 100 to disable speculative execution.

property.name: mr3.task.am.heartbeat.duration.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for sending durations in heartbeats from TaskAttempts. It also determines the granularity of updating the duration of TaskAttempts in speculative execution.

property.name: mr3.task.am.heartbeat.counter.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for sending counters in heartbeats from TaskAttempts

property.name: mr3.task.max.events.per.heartbeat
property.description: Max number of Task events to include in a heartbeat reply

property.name: mr3.container.thread.keep.alive.time.ms
property.description: Time in milliseconds for keeping threads serving TaskAttempts in ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.container.command.num.waits.in.reserved
property.description: Number of times that reserved ContainerWorker attempts to contact DAGAppMaster at an interval of 1 second. Ensure 'mr3.container.command.num.waits.in.reserved * 1 second > mr3.k8s.pod.creation.timeout.ms' on Kubernetes with autoscaling so that new requests for ContainerWorkers can be made while reserved ContainerWorkers are still alive.

property.name: mr3.container.command.num.waits.to.kill
property.description: Number of times that ContainerWorker attempts to contact DAGAppMaster at an interval of 1 second to re-establish the connection. A failed attempt takes about 10 seconds.

property.name: mr3.container.use.termination.checker
property.description: true: check whether TaskAttempts terminate successfully or not after termination requests. If a TaskAttempt fails to terminate, terminate the ContainerWorker. false: do not check. Do not set to false in production environments.

property.name: mr3.container.terminate.on.fatal.error
property.description: true: always terminate ContainerWorkers that throw fatal errors such as OutOfMemoryError. false: do not terminate ContainerWorkers that manage to recover from fatal errors.

property.name: mr3.container.termination.checker.timeout.ms
property.description: Time in milliseconds before checking the termination of a TaskAttempt after a termination request. With the default value, the ContainerWorker checks whether a TaskAttempt has properly terminated 300 seconds after the termination request. If the TaskAttempt has not terminated, the whole ContainerWorker is shut down.

property.name: mr3.container.elastic.execution.memory.commit.ratio
property.description: Multiplier for memory to be allocated to each TaskAttempt. For exmple, a value of 1.5 means that a TaksAttempt created with memory resource of 4GB is actually allocated 6GB of memory in a ContainerWorker.

property.name: mr3.container.task.failure.num.sleeps
property.description: Number of times to sleep (15 seconds each by default) in a ContainerWorker thread after a TaskAttempt fails. Before and after each sleep, the thread tries to allocate a memory block of 1GB to trigger garbage collection. For example, if set to 2, the sequence is: allocate 1GB, sleep 15 seconds, allocate 1GB, sleep 15 seconds, allocate 1GB. If set to 0, do not sleep and do not try to allocate a memory block.

property.name: mr3.container.task.failure.sleep.period.secs
property.description: Time in seconds to sleep after a TaskAttempt fails

property.name: mr3.container.runtime.auto.start.input
property.description: true: automatically start LogicalInputs in RuntimeTasks. false: do not automatically start LogicalInputs.

property.name: mr3.container.close.filesystem.ugi
property.description: true: call FileSystem.closeAllForUGI() after finishing each DAG in ContainerWorkers. false: do not call (for Spark on MR3).

property.name: mr3.container.use.framework.counters
property.description: true: collect framework counters (on garbage collection and process statistics) in ContainerWorkers. false: do not collect framework counters.

property.name: mr3.container.localize.python.working.dir.unsafe
property.description: true: localize Python scripts in working directories of ContainerWorkers. Localizing Python scripts is an unsafe operation: 1) Python scripts are shared by all DAGs; 2) once localized, Python scripts are not deleted. false: do not localize Python scripts.

property.name: mr3.container.use.am.credentials.for.daemon
property.description: true: use the credentials of DAGAppMaster for all DaemonTaskAttempts false: use the credentials of the DAG for all its DaemonTaskAttempts

property.name: mr3.memory.usage.check.scheme
property.description: average: calculate the average memory usage of the current window. maximum: calculate the maximum memory usage of the current window. none: do not calculate memory usage.

property.name: mr3.memory.usage.check.window.length.secs
property.description: Window length in seconds for calculating memory usage

property.name: mr3.check.memory.usage.event.interval.secs
property.description: Time interval in seconds for generating events for calculating memory usage

property.name: mr3.enable.auto.scaling
property.description: true: enable auto-scaling. false: disable auto-scaling.

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.out.threshold.percent
property.description: Minimum percentage of memory usage to trigger scale-out

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.in.threshold.percent
property.description: Maximum percentage of memory usage to trigger scale-in

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.in.min.hosts
property.description: Minimum number of nodes that should remain when performing scale-in

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.out.grace.period.secs
property.description: Cooldown period in seconds after triggering scale-out

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.in.delay.after.scale.out.secs
property.description: Minimum time in seconds to wait after leaving scale-out before triggering scale-in (corresponding to --scale-down-delay-after-add in Kubernetes Autoscaler)

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.in.grace.period.secs
property.description: Cooldown period in seconds after triggering scale-in

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.in.wait.dag.finished
property.description: true: wait until all running DAGs complete before terminating containers in the event of scale-in. false: do not wait and terminate containers immediately.

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.out.num.initial.containers
property.description: greater than zero: number of containers to add in the case of scale-out when no containers are running zero or less: not used

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.out.num.increment.containers
property.description: greater than zero: number of containers to add in the case of scale-out zero or less: use mr3.auto.scale.out.threshold.percent to calculate the number of containers to add

property.name: mr3.auto.scale.in.num.decrement.hosts
property.description: greater than zero: number of hosts to remove in the case of scale-in zero or less: use mr3.auto.scale.in.threshold.percent to calculate the number of hosts to remove

property.name: mr3.prometheus.enable.metrics
property.description: true: DAGAppMaster runs a Prometheus client to export metrics. false: DAGAppMaster does not run a Prometheus client.

property.name: mr3.prometheus.enable.jvm.metrics
property.description: true: export Java VM metrics from DAGAppMaster (using io.prometheus.client.hotspot.DefaultExports). false: do not export Java VM metrics.

property.name: mr3.prometheus.httpserver.port
property.description: Port number for the Prometheus client for DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.prometheus.worker.enable.metrics
property.description: true: Every ContainerWorker runs a Prometheus client to export metrics. false: ContainerWorkers do not run Prometheus clients.

property.name: mr3.prometheus.worker.enable.jvm.metrics
property.description: true: export Java VM metrics from ContainerWorkers (using io.prometheus.client.hotspot.DefaultExports). false: do not export Java VM metrics from ContainerWorkers.

property.name: mr3.prometheus.worker.httpserver.port
property.description: Port number for Prometheus clients for ContainerWorkers. Use 0 if multiple ContainerWorkers run on the same node.

property.name: mr3.principal
property.description: Kerberos principal

property.name: mr3.keytab
property.description: Location of the Kerberos keytab file

property.name: mr3.token.renewal.fraction
property.description: Fraction of the token renewal interval for renewing tokens conservatively

property.name: mr3.token.renewal.retry.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for retrying token renewal

property.name: mr3.token.renewal.num.credentials.files
property.description: Max number of credential files to keep for token renewal

property.name: mr3.token.renewal.hdfs.enabled
property.description: true: automatically renew HDFS tokens. false: do not renew HDFS tokens.

property.name: mr3.token.renewal.hive.enabled
property.description: true: automatically renew Hive tokens. false: do not renew Hive tokens.

property.name: mr3.am.token.renewal.paths
property.description: Path that specifies FileSystem for token renewal. If empty, DAGAppMaster uses the staging directory.

property.name: mr3.token.renewal.pass.credentials.via.memory
property.description: true: DAGAppMaster passes credentials to ContainerWorkers directly via messages. false: DAGAppMaster stores credentials on HDFS.

property.name: mr3.app.history.logging.enabled
property.description: true: enable history logging for Yarn applications and ContainerWorkers. false: disable history logging for Yarn applications and ContainerWorkers.

property.name: mr3.dag.history.logging.enabled
property.description: true: enable history logging for DAGs. false: disable history logging for DAGs.

property.name: mr3.task.history.logging.enabled
property.description: true: enable history logging for Tasks. false: disable history logging for Tasks.

property.name: tez.counters.max
property.description: Max number of Tez counters

property.name: tez.counters.max.groups
property.description: Max number of Tez counters groups

property.name: tez.counters.counter-name.max-length
property.description: Max length of Tez counter names

property.name: tez.counters.group-name.max-length
property.description: Max length of Tez counters group names

property.name: mr3.k8s.api.server.url
property.description: URL for the Kubernetes API server

property.name: mr3.k8s.client.config.file
property.description: Configuration file for creating a Kubernetes client (e.g., ~/.kube/config)

property.name: mr3.k8s.service.account.use.token.ca.cert.path
property.description: true: use mr3.k8s.service.account.token.path and mr3.k8s.service.account.token.ca.cert.path. false: do not use.

property.name: mr3.k8s.service.account.token.path
property.description: Token path for ServiceAccount for the Kubernetes client. Used only when mr3.k8s.service.account.use.token.ca.cert.path is set to true.

property.name: mr3.k8s.service.account.token.ca.cert.path
property.description: Certificate path for ServiceAccount for the Kubernetes client. Used only when mr3.k8s.service.account.use.token.ca.cert.path is set to true.

property.name: mr3.k8s.namespace
property.description: Kubernetes namespace to use when creating a Kubernetes client

property.name: mr3.k8s.am.service.host
property.description: Host associated with the Service for DAGAppMaster Pod. Set only when MR3Client runs outside the Kubernetes cluster and the user creates a Service manually. If not set, MR3 obtains the host from the Service created by MR3Client, e.g., service-master-4110-0.hivemr3.svc.cluster.local.

property.name: mr3.k8s.am.service.port
property.description: Port associated with the Service for DAGAppMaster Pod

property.name: mr3.k8s.nodes.polling.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for querying states of Kubernetes Nodes

property.name: mr3.k8s.pods.polling.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds for querying Pod states

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.creation.timeout.ms
property.description: Time in milliseconds to wait until a new Pod is created

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.image.pull.policy
property.description: Image pull policy for Pods

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.image.pull.secrets
property.description: Image pull secrets for Pods

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.master.serviceaccount
property.description: ServiceAccount for DAGAppMaster Pod

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.serviceaccount
property.description: ServiceAccount for ContainerWorker Pods

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.master.image
property.description: Docker image for DAGAppMaster containers

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.master.user
property.description: User for DAGAppMaster Pod

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.master.emptydirs
property.description: Comma-separated list of directories where emptyDir volumes are mounted for DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.master.hostpaths
property.description: Comma-separated list of directories (on each node) to which hostPath volumes point for DAGAppMaster. `foo1=bar1,foo2=bar2,foo3=bar3` mounts PersistentVolumeClaim `foo1` on directory `bar1` in DAGAppMaster container, and so on.

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.master.node.selector
property.description: Comma-separated list of node selectors for DAGAppMaster Pod (e.g., `masternode=true,hivemr3=true`)

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.master.toleration.specs
property.description: Comma-separated list of toleration specifications for DAGAppMaster Pod. The format of each entry is [key]:[operator]:[value]:[effect]:[toleration in seconds] where [value] and :[toleration in seconds] are optional. Here are a few valid examples: `hello:Equal:world:NoSchedule` `hello:Exists::NoSchedule` `hello:Equal:world:NoExecute:300` `hello:Exists::NoExecute:300` Note that a wrong specification fails the creation of DAGAppMaster Pod. For example, `foo:Equal::NoSchedule` is a wrong specification because [value] must be empty when [operator] is `Exists`. (Cf. `foo:Equal::NoSchedule` is okay.)

property.name: mr3.k8s.master.working.dir
property.description: Working directory for DAGAppMaster container

property.name: mr3.k8s.master.command
property.description: Command for launching Java VM for DAGAppMaster container

property.name: mr3.k8s.master.pod.affinity.match.label
property.description: Label for specifying Pod affinity for DAGAppMaster Pod

property.name: mr3.k8s.master.pod.additional.labels
property.description: Label for specifying Pod affinity for DAGAppMaster Pod

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.image
property.description: Docker image for ContainerWorker containers

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.user
property.description: User for ContainerWorker Pods

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.emptydirs
property.description: Comma-separated list of directories where emptyDir volumes are mounted for ContainerWorkers. These volumes become local directories where intermediate data is written.

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.hostpaths
property.description: Comma-separated list of directories (on each node) to which hostPath volumes point for ContainerWorkers. These volumes become local directories where intermediate data is written.

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.additional.hostpaths
property.description: Comma-separated list of additional directories (on each node) to which hostPath volumes point for ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.node.selector
property.description: Comma-separated list of node selectors for ContainerWorker Pods (e.g., `workernode=true,hivemr3=true`)

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.toleration.specs
property.description: Comma-separated list of toleration specifications for ContainerWorker Pods. The format of each entry is [key]:[operator]:[value]:[effect]:[toleration in seconds] where [value] and :[toleration in seconds] are optional.

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.node.affinity.specs
property.description: Comma-separated list of node affinity specifications for ContainerWorker Pods. The format of each entry is [key]:[operator]:[value#1]:...:[value#N] (e.g., `key1:In:value1:value2:value3'). Internally MR3 uses requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution.

property.name: mr3.k8s.worker.working.dir
property.description: Working directory for ContainerWorker containers

property.name: mr3.k8s.java.io.tmpdir
property.description: Temporary directory for Java in ContainerWorker containers

property.name: mr3.k8s.master.persistentvolumeclaim.mounts
property.description: Comma-separated list of pairs of a PersistentVolumeClaim and its mount point for DAGAppMaster Pod

property.name: mr3.k8s.worker.persistentvolumeclaim.mounts
property.description: Comma-separated list of pairs of a PersistentVolumeClaim and its mount point. `foo1=bar1,foo2=bar2,foo3=bar3` mounts PersistentVolumeClaim `foo1` on directory `bar1` in ContainerWorker containers, and so on.

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.security.context.sysctls
property.description: Comma-separated list of sysctl properties to be set by an init container in a ContainerWorker Pod. E.g., net.core.somaxconn=16384,net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range='1024 65535'

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.init.container.command
property.description: Shell command to be executed by an init container in a ContainerWorker Pod. Before executing the shell command, the init container mounts hostPath volumes specified by `mr3.k8s.pod.worker.hostpaths`. Example: chown 1000:1000 /data1/k8s/; ls -alt /data1/k8s.

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.worker.init.container.image
property.description: Docker image for init containers when mr3.k8s.pod.worker.security.context.sysctls is set. `busybox` works okay.

property.name: mr3.k8s.worker.command
property.description: Command for launching Java VM for ContainerWorker containers

property.name: mr3.k8s.worker.total.max.memory.gb
property.description: Max memory in GB for all ContainerWorker Pods

property.name: mr3.k8s.worker.total.max.cpu.cores
property.description: Max number of cores for all ContainerWorker Pods

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.cpu.cores.max.multiplier
property.description: Multiplier for the limit of CPU cores for each ContainerWorker Pod

property.name: mr3.k8s.pod.memory.max.multiplier
property.description: Multiplier for the limit of memory for each ContainerWorker Pod

property.name: mr3.k8s.conf.dir.configmap
property.description: Name of the ConfigMap carrying all configuration files (such as `mr3-site.xml`

property.name: mr3.k8s.conf.dir.mount.dir
property.description: Mount path for the ConfigMap carrying all configuration files

property.name: mr3.k8s.keytab.secret
property.description: Name of the Secret (containing the Keytab file) to be used by DAGAppMaster

property.name: mr3.k8s.worker.secret
property.description: Name of the Secret to be used by ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.k8s.keytab.mount.dir
property.description: Mount path for the Secret in DAGAppMaster (containing the keytab file) and in ContainerWorkers

property.name: mr3.k8s.keytab.mount.file
property.description: File name for the Secret containing the keytab file. `mr3.k8s.keytab.mount.dir` and `mr3.k8s.keytab.mount.file` specify the full path for the keytab file mounted inside ContainerWorker containers.

property.name: mr3.k8s.mount.keytab.secret
mr3.k8s.mount.worker.secret
property.description: true: mount `mr3.k8s.worker.secret` to `mr3.k8s.keytab.mount.dir`. false: do not mount. Set to true when: secure shuffle is used (`tez.runtime.shuffle.ssl.enable` is set to true in `tez-site.xml`) so as to pass keystore and truststore files.

property.name: mr3.k8s.host.aliases
property.description: Comma-separated list of pairs of a hostname and an IP address. `foo=1.1.1.1,bar=2.2.2.2` registers host `foo` as IP address 1.1.1.1 in ContainerWorker containers, and so on.

property.name: mr3.k8s.shuffle.process.ports
property.description: Comma-separated list of port numbers for shuffle handlers

property.name: mr3.k8s.shufflehandler.process.memory.mb
property.description: Size of memory in MB for the container for shuffle handlers

property.name: mr3.k8s.readiness.probe.initial.delay.secs
property.description: Time in seconds before performing the first readiness probe

property.name: mr3.k8s.readiness.probe.period.secs
property.description: Time interval in seconds for performing the readiness probe

property.name: mr3.k8s.liveness.probe.initial.delay.secs
property.description: Time in seconds before performing the first liveness probe

property.name: mr3.k8s.liveness.probe.period.secs
property.description: Time interval in seconds for performing the liveness probe

property.name: mr3.spark.delay.scheduling.interval.ms
property.description: Time interval in milliseconds of checking delay scheduling
